Context:
The college works closely with employer and community partners to ensure their programs reflect the latest trends and techniques in the industry. Industry leaders play a role in program development to prepare students for skills employers want. Faculty members are industry experts currently working in the field, providing firsthand experience and information. Students have opportunities to work alongside industry professionals on applied research projects, field placements, and on-campus incubators. Industry events and job fairs are held at the campus for students to meet potential employers and develop networking, interview, and presentation skills.

The college works with a variety of employers, from large national and international organizations to small businesses and start-ups in Toronto. Some of these employers include those listed in the George Brown College Alumni Top Employer Report, 2019. For more information and application deadlines, students can sign up on the college website or contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The phone number for general inquiries is 416-415-2000 and TTY is 1-877-515-5559.

The information on the website is subject to change without notice, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
